For some more background you might want  to visit the following bug report:  https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=338621  --> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="/WebResource.axd?d=pajj675yWAJTlxEVF-6gUAjDpT5HQe2kjFe2l53JF_8xR1tYeT0-H7mtNFAr49MwQVtHcqH6tyAMb7Jb0AM6fsYFvc-EXPZlFEu1zSZ451UmDFgVDUDKRojq44IsvyUqvjxo54roFBFSqL6mhAj8xCA7y-GBUB1J8GMjZGce5cY1&t=635409708798495222" media="screen"?> <feed xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:content="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/" xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/">   <title>Home</title>   <subtitle>Royal Holloway, University of London is a leading research-intensive university, with 19 academic departments spanning arts and humanities, sciences, social sciences, management and economics</subtitle>   <link href="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/home.aspx?ListingEvents_SyndicationType=2" />   <generator>Contensis: http://www.contentmanagement.co.uk</generator>   <id>http://www.rhul.ac.uk/home.aspx?SyndicationType=2</id>   <updated>2015-03-12T13:32:40Z</updated>   <link href="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/home.aspx?SyndicationType=2" rel="self" type="application/atom+xml" />   <entry>     <title>Runnymede Festival 2015</title>     <link href="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/runnymedeliteraryfestival.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Stephanie Irwin</name>     </author>     <summary>This year's Runnymede (Literary) Festival will feature a series of lectures as part of our celebration of the sealing of Magna Carta in Runnymede in 1215.  For further information please click on the link above.</summary>     <published>2014-10-03T17:49:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-09T13:09:00Z</updated>     <media:thumbnail url="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsimages/MagnaCartaMom-Cropped-100x100.jpg" />     <id>http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/runnymedeliteraryfestival.aspx</id>     <category term="Literary Festival" />     <category term="magna carta 2015" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Badke Quartet (2)</title>     <link href="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/badkequartet(2).aspx" />     <author>       <name>Sue Heath</name>     </author>     <summary>The critically acclaimed Badke Quartet returns to perform some of the most popular string quartet repertoire from the 20th century.  For further information please click on the link above.</summary>     <published>2014-10-07T15:04:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-10-30T14:35:00Z</updated>     <media:thumbnail url="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsimages/Badke2-Cropped-100x100.jpg" />     <id>http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/badkequartet(2).aspx</id>     <category term="Badke Quartet" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>The changing face of civil liberties in the 21st century</title>     <link href="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/thechangingfaceofcivillibertiesinthe21stcentury.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Louise Chapman</name>     </author>     <summary>Don't miss this important talk by Ruth Hunt, Chief Executive of Stonewall, who we welcome onto campus in this key anniversary year of Magna Carta.  For more details click the link above.</summary>     <published>2015-02-26T11:52:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-06T10:25:00Z</updated>     <media:thumbnail url="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsimages/RuthHunt-Cropped-100x100.jpg" />     <id>http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/thechangingfaceofcivillibertiesinthe21stcentury.aspx</id>     <category term="Stonewall" />     <category term="magna carta" />     <category term="civil liberties" />     <category term="ruth hunt" />     <category term="Runnymede Literary Festival" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Sex, Violence, Art: framing the new American cinema</title>     <link href="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/sex,violence,artframingthenewamericancinema.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Sue Heath</name>     </author>     <summary>In 1967 Time Magazine hailed the birth of a "New American Cinema". This lecture will examine how a multi-faceted US film culture, emerging during the 1960s, contributed to and helped shape that cinema's distinctive sensibility: formal ambition and innovation,challenging and topical content, and a reinvigorated awareness of film's artistic and social significance or as Time summarised it, "Sex, Violence, Art".  For further information please click on the link above.</summary>     <published>2014-10-02T10:02:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-02-26T10:41:00Z</updated>     <media:thumbnail url="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsimages/BarryLangford-Cropped-100x100.jpg" />     <id>http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/sex,violence,artframingthenewamericancinema.aspx</id>     <category term="Barry Langford" />     <category term="Inaugural lecture" />     <category term="media arts" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>From Greeks Abroad to the Greek Diaspora: Hellenism in a changing world</title>     <link href="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/fromgreeksabroadtothegreekdiasporahellenisminachangingworld.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Sue Heath</name>     </author>     <summary>During the last three centuries the world has been dominated by the Nation-State ethos and its territorial configuration. Diasporas have lost importance and suffered severe persecutions. However, new trends, such as globalisation, multipolar organisation, global problems, network economy and information society, have shrank state territoriality; as a result, Diasporas regained significance.  For further information please click on the above link.</summary>     <published>2014-10-30T15:05:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-12-18T11:34:00Z</updated>     <media:thumbnail url="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsimages/Hellenic-Cropped-100x100.jpg" />     <id>http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/fromgreeksabroadtothegreekdiasporahellenisminachangingworld.aspx</id>     <category term="Diaspora" />   </entry>   <entry> <title>Classics Day 2015</title>     <link href="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/classicsday2015.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Louise Chapman</name>     </author>     <summary>A day of Classics-based activities, organised by Royal Holloway's Classical Society.</summary>     <published>2015-02-27T15:26:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-02-27T15:21:00Z</updated> Hawley" />     <category term="Classical Society" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Women's History Month talk on Female Artists</title>     <link href="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/artcollectionandpicturegallery/whatson/eventarticles/womenshistorymonthtalkonfemaleartists.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Laura Macculloch</name>     </author>     <summary>Royal Holloway Art Collections present an event for Women's History Month. Come along and learn more about the women in our art collection</summary>     <published>2015-03-05T16:42:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-05T16:49:00Z</updated>     <media:thumbnail url="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/ArtCollectionandPictureGallery/Whatson/eventimages/GeoffreyandChristopherHerringham-Cropped-100x100.jpg" />     <id>http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/artcollectionandpicturegallery/whatson/eventarticles/womenshistorymonthtalkonfemaleartists.aspx</id>     <category term="women artists" />     <category term="female artists" />     <category term="Herringham" />     <category term="Herringham Collection" />     <category term="Swynnerton" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Meritocracy and the establishment</title>     <link href="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/meritocracyandtheestablishment.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Stephanie Irwin</name>     </author>     <summary>As part of our Magna Carta season of events, we're pleased to welcome Professor Peter Hennessy, Baron Hennessy of Nymphsfield and Attlee Profesor of Contemporary British History at Queen Mary's, University of London. For more details click on the link above.</summary>     <published>2015-02-26T12:06:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-09T19:06:00Z</updated>     <media:thumbnail url="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsimages/LordHennessey2-Cropped-100x100.jpg" />     <id>http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/meritocracyandtheestablishment.aspx</id>     <category term="magna carta" />     <category term="meritocracy" />     <category term="lectures" />     <category term="Runnymede Literary Festival" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>The dual exploitation of enslaved women in America, c.1815-1865</title>     <link href="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/thedualexploitationofenslavedwomeninamericac18151865.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Louise Chapman</name>     </author>     <summary>Bedford Lecture 2015: This lecture provides an overview of the lives of enslaved women in America from the colonial era through to emancipation in 1865.</summary>     <published>2015-02-18T11:26:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-02-18T12:10:00Z</updated>     <media:thumbnail url="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsimages/bedfordlectureemailimage-Cropped-100x100.jpg" />     <id>http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/thedualexploitationofenslavedwomeninamericac18151865.aspx</id>     <category term="Moore Lecture Theatre" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Royal Holloway Symphony Orchestra (2)</title>     <link href="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/royalhollowaysymphonyorchestra(2).aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rob Turner</name>     </author>     <summary>Royal Holloway's principal Concerto Competition winner Carwyn Jones performs Shostakovich's epic First Cello Concerto. In a programme exclusively devoted to Russian music, Rebecca Miller will speak at the concert about thedifferent orchestrations of Mussorgsky's renowned Pictures at an Exhibition.  For further information please click on the link above.</summary>     <published>2014-10-07T15:15:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-06T16:36:00Z</updated>     <media:thumbnail url="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsimages/Chorus1-Cropped-100x100.jpg" />     <id>http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/royalhollowaysymphonyorchestra(2).aspx</id>     <category term="Symphony Orchestra" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Practical Applications of Quantum Theory</title>     <link href="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/practicalapplicationsofquantumtheory.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Sue Heath</name>     </author>     <summary>Modern quantum theory is our most fundamental theory of how the universe works. But what use is it? With the aid of live experiments, Royal Holloway physicist, Dr Phil Meeson, will take you on a grand tour, demonstrating the biggest surprises of quantum phenomena and describing how we are learning to take it out of the laboratory and into the real world.  For further information please click on the link above.</summary>     <published>2015-02-24T10:54:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-02-24T11:20:00Z</updated>     <media:thumbnail url="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsimages/PhilMeesonheadshot-Cropped-100x100.jpg" />     <id>http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/practicalapplicationsofquantumtheory.aspx</id>     <category term="Windsor Building" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Royal Holloway Sinfonietta with CHROMA</title>     <link href="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/royalhollowaysinfoniettawithchroma.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Sue Heath</name>     </author>     <summary>Royal Holloway Sinfonietta with CHROMA.  For further information please click on the link above.</summary>     <published>2014-10-07T15:33:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-10-30T15:06:00Z</updated>     <media:thumbnail url="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsimages/Music-Cropped-100x100.jpg" />     <id>http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/royalhollowaysinfoniettawithchroma.aspx</id>     <category term="Sinfonietta" />     <category term="Chroma" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>HARC Lecture Series Making Space for Art: Curating a static collection: Kettle's Yard as a unique document of Modernism</title>     <link href="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/artcollectionandpicturegallery/whatson/eventarticles/harcseriesmakingspaceforartcuratingastaticcollection.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Laura Macculloch</name>     </author>     <summary>This is the fourth lecture in the HARC series 'Making Space for Art' which explores the challenges of curating. This lecture by Dr Jennifer Powell discusses working with the modernist collection at Kettle's Yard, University of Cambridge.</summary>     <published>2015-01-14T14:45:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-05T16:54:00Z</updated>     <media:thumbnail url="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/ArtCollectionandPictureGallery/Whatson/eventimages/KYcottagedroom-Cropped2-100x100.jpg" />     <id>http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/artcollectionandpicturegallery/whatson/eventarticles/harcseriesmakingspaceforartcuratingastaticcollection.aspx</id>     <category term="art and culture" />     <category term="art collection" />     <category term="curating" />     <category term="Kettle's Yard" />     <category term="picture gallery" />     <category term="harc" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Chamber Music Competition</title>     <link href="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/chambermusiccompetition.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Sue Heath</name>     </author>     <summary>As the culmination of our chamber music programme, the Badke Quartet will adjudicate the first Chamber Music competition at Royal Holloway. Chamber groups who have been working together all year and coached by the quartet will compete for a prize of \ufffd\ufffd200 and a recital platform during the PLAY! Festival in June.  For further information please click on the link above.</summary>     <published>2014-10-02T17:35:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-10-30T15:07:00Z</updated>     <media:thumbnail url="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsimages/ChamberOrchestra-Cropped-100x100.jpg" />     <id>http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/chambermusiccompetition.aspx</id>     <category term="Chamber Music" />     <category term="Badke Quartet" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>The 3rd International Symposium on Learning and Data Sciences (SLDS 2015)</title>     <link href="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/thethirdinternationalsymposiumonlearninganddatasciences(slds2015).aspx" />     <author>       <name>Sue Heath</name>     </author>     <summary>The 3rd Symposium on learning and data sciences focuses on contemporary practical and theoretical problems in Data Analysis, Data Mining, Machine Learning and Statistical Learning.</summary>     <published>2014-12-02T16:56:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-12-02T16:50:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/thethirdinternationalsymposiumonlearninganddatasciences(slds2015).aspx</id>     <category term="Sciences" />     <category term="symposium" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Great Charter Festival</title>     <link href="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/800yearsofthemagnacartathegreatcharterfestival.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Stephanie Irwin</name>     </author>     <summary>Join in our exciting celebrations to find out more about the legacy of Magna Carta. Get involved in hands-on activities and performances, sample medieval food and drink, or try your hand in our crafts market place and gaming area \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd there will be something for all the family.  For further information please click on the link above.</summary>     <published>2014-10-02T09:39:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-03T13:23:00Z</updated>     <media:thumbnail url="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsimages/magnacarta-Cropped-100x100.jpg" />     <id>http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/800yearsofthemagnacartathegreatcharterfestival.aspx</id>     <category term="magna carta 2015" />     <category term="festival" />     <category term="community" />     <category term="family" />     <category term="arts" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>National Security and the Rule of Law; competing interests or complementary priorities?</title>     <link href="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/nationalsecurityandtheruleoflaw;competinginterestsorcomplementarypriorities.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Sue Heath</name>     </author>     <summary>Since 9/11 there has been much discussion about the perceived 'competing' interests of the rule of law and national security. In light of recent events in Syria and Iraq, these issues continue to be highly topical. In this lecture Jack Straw will reflect on his time in government and how the last Labour government sought to ensure the safety of the UK, while also upholding the rule of the law. He will then consider recent developments, post the 2010 election, and whether the balance of these two factors has shifted in recent years.  For further information please click on the link above.</summary>     <published>2014-10-02T09:31:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-01-05T16:12:00Z</updated>     <media:thumbnail url="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsimages/JackStraw-Cropped-100x100.jpg" />     <id>http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/nationalsecurityandtheruleoflaw;competinginterestsorcomplementarypriorities.aspx</id>     <category term="Jack Straw" />     <category term="Magna Carta Lecture" />     <category term="magna carta 2015" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Heritage Open Day</title>     <link href="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/heritageopenday.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Sue Heath</name>     </author>     <summary>Royal Holloway, University of London, welcomes the public to explore its spectacular Grade 1 Listed Founder's Building, Picture Gallery, Chapel, refurbished Boilerhouse and extensive grounds.  For further information please click on the link above.</summary>     <published>2014-10-02T09:17:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-10-30T15:14:00Z</updated>     <media:thumbnail url="http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsimages/FoundersBuilding-Cropped-100x100.jpg" />     <id>http://www.rhul.ac.uk/aboutus/newsandevents/events/eventsarticles/heritageopenday.aspx</id>     <category term="Heritage Open Day" />     <category term="Guided Tours" />     <category term="Founder's Building" />   </entry> </feed>
